body_content.explanation: the things that can be seen behind the main things or people in a picture:
examples: The little figure that you can just see in the background of the photograph is me.
The artist himself did not paint the backgrounds to his pictures - they were done by his pupils.
He has photographed her against lots of different backgrounds.
They were filmed against a background of dark fir trees.
The book's cover has white lettering on a blue background.

body_content.explanation: sounds that can be heard behind other sounds that are louder:
examples: We couldn't hear what they were saying on the tape - there was too much background noise.
If you listen carefully to this piece of music, you can hear a flute in the background.

body_content.explanation: the conditions that existed before a particular event happened, and that help to explain why it happened:
examples: These decisions have had to be made against a background of high unemployment.

body_content.explanation: information about something that helps people understand it :
examples: Can you give me some background on the situation?
The official website has a wealth of background on the history of the tournament.

body_content.explanation: If someone or something is in the background, they are not or it is not the main point of attention:
examples: He stayed in the background, but the others would do nothing without his approval.
Her worries about her job have faded into the background since she learned about her father's illness.

body_content.explanation: your family and your experience of education, living conditions, money, etc.:
examples: She has a background in publishing, so she might be able to help you with your book.
The school has students from many different ethnic/cultural/religious backgrounds.
They come from a privileged/wealthy background.

body_content.explanation: used to refer to something that is done before, and in preparation for, something else:
examples: The book provides background information on the history of the region.
Students are expected to do some background reading before the course starts.
